Show Differences Dialog Box

Select Actions | Show Differences to view the differences between two revisions, two workfiles, or a revision and a workfile.

Field Descriptions

General Tab
Compare Select the type of items to compare: A revision and a workfile, Revisions in a single versioned file, Revisions in two different versioned files, or Two workfiles.
First File First File (text field): The name of the first file you selected to compare. If you are comparing workfiles, you can specify a different file by entering a file name or clicking the Browse button; otherwise, the field is read-only and you must exit the dialog if you wish to select a different file.

Revision: The revision of the file to compare. To specify a different revision, click the Browse button to select a revision by version label, revision number, or promotion group. This field does not appear if you select Two Workfiles from the Compare menu.
Second File Second File (text field): The name of the second workfile you selected to compare. To specify a different file, enter it in the text field, or click the Browse button to select one. This field appears only if you select Two Workfiles from the Compare menu.

Revision: The revision of the file to compare. To specify a different revision, click the Browse button to select a revision by version label, revision number, or promotion group. This field does not appear if you select Two Workfiles from the Compare menu.
Ignore white space Select to ignore trailing, intervening, and leading white spaces, tabs, and form feeds.
Advanced Tab
Cobol Masking Select the Cobol Masking check box to use the default Cobol masking definition for Cobol files.
Mask Ranges The default value is automatically displayed in the Mask Ranges field. The default is mask columns 73-80 and mask columns 1 through 6 only if these columns are numeric. You may override these values by entering new values.
Record Length Enter the length of records in fixed-length files so that Version Manager can generate deltas based on logical lines. Do not enter a value in this field for variable length files. Doing so could cause the output to be invalid or incorrect.
